p: China contains a wide range of vegetation types, from tropical rainforest to boreal coniferous forests and alpine vegetation ( Figure 1; Hou, 2001). China is home to more than 33,000 vascular plant species and among the world’s richest countries in terms of plant biodiversity ( López-Pujol et al., 2006). Annual average temperatures range from -21.0°C to 26.0°C and increase from north to south. Annual precipitation ranges from 0 to 2250 mm and decreases from southeast to northwest. A steep climate gradient and abundant plant species make China an ideal region to analyze the response of vegetation to changing climates.
